paragraph.heading:
Periphaena pentasteriscus ( Clark & Campbell, 1942 )
( Fig. 17I, J )

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Heliodiscus pentasteriscus Clark & Campbell, 1942: 39
, pl. 3, fig. 8. —
Petrushevskaya & Kozlova 1972: 523
, pl. 13, figs 6, 7.

subSubSection.paragraph: GEOGRAPHIC DISTRIBUTION. — Atlantic Ocean, California , Voronesh Anticline.

Periphaena perplexus ( Clark & Campbell, 1942 )
( Fig. 10A, B )

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Heliodiscus perplexus Clark & Campbell, 1942: 40
, pl. 3, fig. 12.

Trochodiscus hoplites Lipman, 1953: 141
, pl. XII, fig. 7.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Heliodiscus lentis Lipman, 1960: 83
, pl. XI, figs 5, 6; pl. XIV, figs 1, 2. — Kozlova 1984: 205 , pl. 10, fig. 10; 1990: pl. XI, fig. 12.

Astrophacus testatus Kozlova
in Kozlova & Gorbovets 1966: 73, pl. XI, fig. 7.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Heliodiscus inca
–
Kozlova 1999: 222
, pl. 17, fig. 14; pl. 21, fig. 8; pl. 24, fig. 2 (only).

subSubSection.paragraph: GEOGRAPHIC DISTRIBUTION. — California , Northern and Western Siberia, eastern slope of the Ural Mountains, Russian Platform, southern part.

It is very difficult to see the difference between
Heliodiscus perplexus
and
Heliodiscus lentis Lipman, 1960
(p. 83, pl. XI, figs 5, 6; pl. XIV, figs 1, 2), as the thickness of spines might be a result of a dissolution and because of that it can not be considered as the feature for a new species definition. To our point of view all above mentioned species are synonyms.

H . inca sensu Kozlova (1999)
is a group of species, in a major quantity of images, different to
H . inca
holotype by: 1) the number and shape of main spines – for example, pl. 17, fig. 14 and pl. 21, fig. 8, the specimen has 10 or more round main spines, instead of nine angular, described by Clark & Campbell; and 2) by the surface porosity – for example, pl. 40, fig. 9, specimen has an irregular size and distribution of pores, and a round main spines.

Periphaena quadrata ( Clark & Campbell, 1942 )
( Fig. 16B, C )

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Heliodiscus quadratus Clark & Campbell, 1942: 38
, pl. 3, fig. 16. — Kozlova 1990 : pl. XI, fig. 2.
